sen.j: 県犬養 大伴（あがた（の）いぬかい の おおとも、生年不詳 - 大宝 (日本)元年1月29日 (旧暦)（701年3月13日））は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: AGATA (NO) INUKAI no Otomo (year of birth unknown - March 13, 701) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
AGATA (NO) INUKAI no Otomo (year of birth unknown - March 13, 701) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
AGATA (NO) INUKAI no Otomo (year of birth unknown - March 13, 701) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.

sen.j: 氏は犬養（いぬかい）とも、名は大侶とも書く。
sen.e: His clan name was also written Inukai (犬養) and his given name was Otomo (大侶).
His clan name (県犬養) was also written Inukai (犬養) and his given name (大伴) was Otomo (大侶).
sen.cmt: 元の漢字も表記しました。
sen.e: His clan name (県犬養) was also written Inukai (犬養) and his given name (大伴) was Otomo (大侶).

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「あがたのいぬかひのおほとも」、あるいは「いぬかひのおほとも」。
sen.e: In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced as "AGATAINUKAI no Otomo"
In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced as "AGATAINUKAHI no Ohotomo" or "INUKAHI no Ohotomo".
sen.cmt: 旧仮名の読み方に変更しました。
sen.e: In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced as "AGATAINUKAHI no Ohotomo" or "INUKAHI no Ohotomo".

sen.j: 姓は連、後に宿禰。
sen.e: His hereditary title was Muraji (second highest title under Yamato dynasty), later granted Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).
His hereditary title was Muraji (second highest title under Yamato dynasty), later granted Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).
His hereditary title was Muraji (second highest title under Yamato dynasty), later granted Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）に従った。
sen.e: He followed Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin war in 672.
He followed the Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin war in 672.
He followed the Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin war in 672.

sen.j: その後この天皇に仕えた。
sen.e: Later, he served Emperor Tenmu.
Later, he served the Emperor Tenmu.
Later, he served the Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 贈正広参。
sen.e: He was awarded shokosan (the sixth grade of shoko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank).
He was awarded shokosan (the sixth grade of shoko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank).
He was awarded shokosan (the sixth grade of shoko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank).

tit.e: His achievement in the Jinshin War.
His achievement in the Jinshin War.
His achievement in the Jinshin War.

sen.j: 県犬養大伴は、壬申の乱が起こったとき、大海人皇子の舎人であった。
sen.e: AGATAINUKAI no Otomo was Prince Oama's toneri (palace servant) when the Jinshin War started.
AGATAINUKAI no Otomo was Prince Oama's toneri (palace servant) when the Jinshin War started.
AGATAINUKAI no Otomo was Prince Oama's toneri (palace servant) when the Jinshin War started.

sen.j: 大海人皇子が挙兵のため吉野から東国に出立したときに、皇子に従った二十数人の男の一人であった。
sen.e: He was one of more than two dozen of Prince Oama's followers when Prince left Yoshino for Togoku to take up army.
He was one of about two dozen of Prince Oama's followers when the Prince left Yoshino for Togoku to take up army.
sen.cmt: 二十数人なのでmore than→aboutに変更しました。
sen.e: He was one of about two dozen of Prince Oama's followers when the Prince left Yoshino for Togoku to take up army.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』によれば、6月24日の出発のとき、大海人皇子は馬がなく徒歩で出発した。
sen.e: According to"Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), on Jun 24, Prince Oama left on foot as he had no horse.
According to"Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), on July 24, Prince Oama left on foot as he had no horse.
sen.cmt: 日付を新暦に変更しました。
sen.e: According to"Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), on July 24, Prince Oama left on foot as he had no horse.

sen.j: たまたま途中で県犬養連大伴の馬に遭遇し、それに乗った。
sen.e: The Prince found a horse owned by AGATAINUKAI no Otomo by chance and acquired it.
The Prince found a horse owned by AGATAINUKAI no Otomo by chance and acquired it.
The Prince found a horse owned by AGATAINUKAI no Otomo by chance and acquired it.

sen.j: 妃の鸕野讚良皇女（後の持統天皇）は輿に乗った。
sen.e: Princess Uno no Sarara (later Empress Jito) got into a Mikoshi (portable carriage).
The Princess Uno no Sarara (later Empress Jito) got into a Mikoshi (portable carriage).
The Princess Uno no Sarara (later Empress Jito) got into a Mikoshi (portable carriage).

sen.j: 津振川で皇子の馬が追いつき、皇子はこれに乗りかえた。
sen.e: Prince on the horse caught up with Princess at the Tsufuri-gawa river and got into the carriage.
The prince on the horse caught up with the princess at the Tsufuri-gawa river and got into the carriage.
The prince on the horse caught up with the princess at the Tsufuri-gawa river and got into the carriage.

sen.j: 津振川は吉野川（紀の川）支流の津風呂川とされる。
sen.e: It is believed that Tsufuri-gawa river is the Tsuburo-gawa river which is a tributary of Kino-kawa river.
It is believed that Tsufuri-gawa river is the Tsuburo-gawa river which is a tributary of Kino-kawa river.
It is believed that Tsufuri-gawa river is the Tsuburo-gawa river which is a tributary of Kino-kawa river.

sen.j: 現代の歴史学者の間では皇子の挙兵は入念に計画されたものだとする説が有力である。
sen.e: Among modern historians, a theory that Prince Oama carefully planned rising an army is accepted.
Among modern historians, a theory that the Prince Oama carefully planned raising an army is accepted.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を追加しました。rising→raisｎｎingに変更しました。
sen.e: Among modern historians, a theory that the Prince Oama carefully planned raising an army is accepted.

sen.j: その説では、書紀には大海人皇子がやむなく立ったように書かれているが、それは大海人皇子の行動を正当化するためにした曲筆となる。
sen.e: Although "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) reported that Prince Oama had no choice but to take up arms, the theory points out that this might be a misrepreresentation to justify the Prince's act.

Although "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) reported that the Prince Oama had no choice but to take up arms, the theory points out that this might be a misrepreresentation to justify the prince's act.

Although "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) reported that the Prince Oama had no choice but to take up arms, the theory points out that this might be a misrepreresentation to justify the prince's act.

sen.j: 行き当たりばったりで馬を得たように記されているのも、書紀の潤色になる。
sen.e: A report in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) that the Prince got the horse by chance may also have being simple dramatization.
A report in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) that the Prince got the horse by chance may also have been simple dramatization.
A report in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) that the Prince got the horse by chance may also have been simple dramatization.

sen.j: 加えて、吉野から津風呂川に出るための峠越えでは馬が利用できないために、馬を回り道させたのを、慌しく出立した描写に変えたのではないかと推定する説もある。
sen.e: In addition, there is a belief that "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) changed the description of a detour, getting to the Tsuburo-gawa river from Yoshino since horses could not get over a pass at that time.

In addition, there is a belief that "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) changed the description of a detour, getting to the Tsuburo-gawa river from Yoshino since horses could not get over a pass at that time.

In addition, there is a belief that "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) changed the description of a detour, getting to the Tsuburo-gawa river from Yoshino since horses could not get over a pass at that time.

sen.j: その後の内戦で県犬養大伴が果たした役割については、書紀に記載がない。
sen.e: There is no description in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) about AGATAINUKAI no Otomo's role in the later domestic warfare.
There is no description in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) about AGATAINUKAI no Otomo's role in the later domestic warfare.
There is no description in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) about AGATAINUKAI no Otomo's role in the later domestic warfare.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』には、12月4日に勲功ある人を選んで冠位を増し、小山位以上を与えたとする記事がある。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki", on December 4, the number of cap rank was increased to award a shosen (cap rank) or upper rank to those who were selected for their deed of valor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外対処
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), on December 28, the number of cap ranks were increased to grant a shosen (cap rank) or upper rank to those who were selected for their deeds of valor.
sen.cmt: 日付を新暦に変更しました。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), on December 28, the number of cap ranks were increased to grant a shosen (cap rank) or upper rank to those who were selected for their deeds of valor.

sen.j: そのため県犬養大伴もこれと同じかそれ以上の位を得たと思われる。
sen.e: Therefore, AGATAINUKAI no Otomo was awarded the same or upper rank.
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, AGATAINUKAI no Otomo was awarded the same or upper rank.
Therefore, AGATAINUKAI no Otomo was awarded the same or upper rank.

sen.j: また、壬申の功により県犬養連大侶が100戸を封じられたことが、『続日本紀』大宝 (日本)元年（701年）7月21日条から知られる。
sen.e: July 21, 701 of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) reported that AGATAINUKAI no Otomo was allotted 100 households for his achievement in the Jinshin War.
July 21 (August 29 in new calendar), 701 of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) reported that AGATAINUKAI no Otomo was allotted 100 households for his achievement in the Jinshin War.
sen.cmt: 新暦の日付を追加しました。
sen.e: July 21 (August 29 in new calendar), 701 of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) reported that AGATAINUKAI no Otomo was allotted 100 households for his achievement in the Jinshin War.

sen.j: 天武天皇9年（680年）7月5日に、天皇は犬養連大伴の家に出向いて病を見舞った。
sen.e: On July 5, 680, Emperor Tenmu visited the sick AGATAINUKAI no Otomo at his home.
On August 5, 680, the Emperor Tenmu visited the sick AGATAINUKAI no Otomo at his home.
sen.cmt: 日付を新暦に変更しました。
sen.e: On August 5, 680, the Emperor Tenmu visited the sick AGATAINUKAI no Otomo at his home.

sen.j: 天武天皇13年（684年）12月2日に、県犬養氏ら50の連姓の諸氏は宿禰の姓になった。
sen.e: On December 2, 684, 50 clans including Agatainukai were awarded the title of Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).
On January 12, 685, 50 Muraji clans including Agatainukai were awarded the title of Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).
sen.cmt: 日付を新暦に変更しました。「連姓の」を追加しました。
sen.e: On January 12, 685, 50 Muraji clans including Agatainukai were awarded the title of Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).

sen.j: 天武天皇14年（685年）9月18日に、天武天皇は皇族・臣下と大安殿で博打をして遊んだ。
sen.e: On September 18, 685, Emperor Tenmu enjoyed gambling with the Imperial family and vassals at Oyasumi-dono.
On October 21, 685, the Emperor Tenmu enjoyed gambling with the Imperial family and vassals at Oyasumi-dono.
sen.cmt: 日付を新暦に変更しました。冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: On October 21, 685, the Emperor Tenmu enjoyed gambling with the Imperial family and vassals at Oyasumi-dono.

sen.j: このとき天皇は大安殿の中に、皇族と臣下は殿の前に位置した。
sen.e: During the gambling, the Emperor sat in Oyasumi-dono with the Imperial family and vassals in front of him.
During the gambling, the Emperor sat in Oyasumi-dono with the Imperial family and vassals in front of him.
During the gambling, the Emperor sat in Oyasumi-dono with the Imperial family and vassals in front of him.

sen.j: 県犬養宿禰大侶はこの日に天皇の衣と袴を与えられた10人の中の一人であった。
sen.e: AGATAINUKAI no Sukune Otomo was one of 10 vassals who were granted the Emperor's robe and formal divided skirt for men.
AGATAINUKAI no Sukune Otomo was one of ten vassals who were granted the Emperor's robe and formal divided skirt for men.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。
sen.e: AGATAINUKAI no Sukune Otomo was one of ten vassals who were granted the Emperor's robe and formal divided skirt for men.

sen.j: 朱鳥元年（686年）8月9日に天武天皇は亡くなり、27日に皇族、臣下が天皇に対して誄を述べた。
sen.e: On Aug 9, 686, Emperor Tenmu passed away and the Imperial family and his vassals started shinobigoto (a speech given to the spirit of the departed about his/her merit) to the Emperor on Aug 27.

On September 12, 686, the Emperor Tenmu passed away and the Imperial family and his vassals started shinobigoto (a speech given to the spirit of the departed about his/her merit) to the Emperor on September 30.
sen.cmt: 日付を新暦に変更しました。
sen.e: On September 12, 686, the Emperor Tenmu passed away and the Imperial family and his vassals started shinobigoto (a speech given to the spirit of the departed about his/her merit) to the Emperor on September 30.

sen.j: このとき、直大参の県犬養宿禰大伴が誄して宮内のこと全般を語った。
sen.e: At that ceremony, AGATAINUKAI no Sukune Otomo had achieved the rank of jikidaisan (the thirteenth grade of jikidai rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank), spoke about the general affairs of the imperial court.

At that ceremony, AGATAINUKAI no Sukune Otomo, who had achieved the rank of jikidaisan (the thirteenth grade of jikidai rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank), spoke about overall things of the imperial court in remembrance of the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 「誄して」を追加しました。whoを追加しました。誄して話した内容なので「全般」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: At that ceremony, AGATAINUKAI no Sukune Otomo, who had achieved the rank of jikidaisan (the thirteenth grade of jikidai rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank), spoke about overall things of the imperial court in remembrance of the Emperor.

sen.j: これにより彼が宮内のことに携わっていたと知れる。
sen.e: This proved that he was involved in the imperial court.
This proved that he was involved in the imperial court.
This proved that he was involved in the imperial court.

sen.j: 大宝元年（701年）正月29日に県犬養宿禰大侶は死んだ。
sen.e: On January 29, 701, AGATAINUKAI no Sukune Otomo died.
On January 29, 701, AGATAINUKAI no Sukune Otomo died.
On January 29, 701, AGATAINUKAI no Sukune Otomo died.

sen.j: このときの位は直広壱であった。
sen.e: At the time, his rank was jikikoichi (the tenth grade of jikiko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank).
At the time, his rank was jikikoichi (the tenth grade of jikiko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank).
At the time, his rank was jikikoichi (the tenth grade of jikiko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank).

sen.j: 文武天皇は、夜気王らを遣わして詔を述べさせ、壬申の乱での功によって正広参の位を贈った。
sen.e: Emperor Monmu sent Yakio (夜気王) and other vassals to impose an imperial edict that granted shokosan (the sixth grade of shoko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank) for his achievements in the Jinshin War.
sen.cmt: 正しい読み方が不明です
sen.e: Emperor Monmu sent Yakio (夜気王) and other vassals to impose an imperial edict that granted shokosan (the sixth grade of shoko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank) for his achievements in the Jinshin War.

Emperor Monmu sent Yakio (夜気王) and other vassals to impose an imperial edict that granted shokosan (the sixth grade of shoko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank) for his achievements in the Jinshin War.
